title: Celithemis elisa
text:
The calico pennant ("Celithemis elisa") is a species of <a href="dragonfly">dragonfly</a> in the family <a href="Libellulidae">Libellulidae</a>. It is native to eastern Canada and eastern United States.
Description.
This dragonfly is 24 to 34 millimeters long, with a hindwing 25 to 30 millimeters long. It can be identified by the brown spots at the bases and tips of the wings. The <a href="pterostigma">pterostigma</a> is yellow in younger individuals, and red in older. The face is yellow, turning red in older male specimens. The thorax is yellow-brown with a large dark stripe and several smaller brown stripes. The abdomen is dark with paler markings.
Biology.
This species lives near calm water bodies surrounded by vegetation.
